ygData.subject: Hidden Inefficiency In NEAT Associated with Standard Param Values

Investigation of redundant organisms in NEAT using standard param 
values h=
as shown an approximate 10 percent redundancy factor as follows:

Populatio=
n Size: 100
Number Outputs: 10 (i.e. 10-dimensional coordinate space)
Dista=
nce Tolerance: 1.0E-6 (in non-normalized coordinates)

Duplicates in Genera=
tion 1 were ignored.

"A" =3D Generation Number
"B" =3D Cum # of Redundant =
Organisms (i.e. less than tol distance apart)
"C" =3D Total Number of Organ=
isms Evaluated

"A","B","C"
1,0,100
2,8,200
3,17,300
4,30,400
5,44,500
6,56=
,600
7,65,700
8,76,800
9,94,900
10,115,1000

In instances in which the fitn=
ess computational requirements are non-
trivial, screening and fitness subs=
titution for redundant organisms is 
justified. The issues of search space =
coverage and variaion with param 
value changes were not addressed. 

( Ref=
erence Resource: ANN: A Library for Approximate Nearest Neighbor 
Searching=
, Mount, David M., Arya, Sunil, 
http://www.cs.umd.edu/~mount/ANN/ )
